unit_learning_outcomes.description: Explore the concept of 'Country' as a relational space
Describe contemporary Dharug cultural practices and how these are connected to older knowledge systems
Recognise who Dharug people are and their connection to place
Examine the politics of place and the impact of colonisation on Dharug people and Country

assessments.description: Write an essay on the essay topic – MAXIMUM 2000 WORDS
A variety of activities in the online and fieldwork classes.
Create a five-minute Video in relation to a place of Dharug significance on Dharug Country.

data.unit_offering_text:

Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Fully online/virtual
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde

Session 1, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: ABST1020 - Dharug Country: Presences, Places and People
data.description: This unit introduces students to Dharug perspectives about Country, spiritual concepts including human and non-human ancestors, and the importance of connecting to place and belonging. Students will learn valuable insights from a diverse group of Dharug community members telling their own stories about sites of significance to them. Students will be introduced to Dharug language, art and other cultural practices demonstrating the continuity of knowledges that Dharug people have maintained for over 65,000 years.This unit allows students to connect with contemporary Dharug people and learn about the impact of colonisation on the community and also better understand how Dharug people and communities have resisted and survived. Dharug people will share stories of importance so students can be more aware of the politics of place.
data.search_title: ABST1020 - Dharug Country: Presences, Places and People
